@quicksketch Here is a branch that I made a while back that has our phpcs rules updated for use with squizlabs/php_codesniffer:3.x. https://github.com/hosef/coder/tree/update-php-codesniffer. Where do you think would be the best place to merge this? I could make a PR against serundeputy/coder, which is what the composer package is based on, or I could redo it to apply to the Coder Review module.

hosef/coder
"Developer module" which reviews your code identifying coding style problems and where updates to the API are required. - hosef/coder
I'd love to get this installed on my computer.
@Laryn If you want to test it, you can clone the repo, and then go into the directory and do 'composer install'.
After that, you can run it with './vendor/bin/phpcs --standard=./coder_sniffer/Backdrop'
Thanks! Is it possible to upgrade the PHP_CODESNIFFER version or does it depend on the < 2.0 version?
"UPGRADE TO PHP_CODESNIFFER 2.0 TO FIX ERRORS AUTOMATICALLY"
Just did a test and it doesn't seem to be working with later versions of phpcs.
Oh, wrong branch. :flushed:
Now that I remembered to checkout the appropriate branch before doing everything else, it seems to be looking good at a glance. Great!
@Joseph Flatt ++
flatt** Cheers (Karma: 3)
I think that we are using 1.x because we support php5.3 still. PHPCS 2.x and later require 5.4 I believe.
I believe that you are correct, but I think we need to update it because the 1.x branch has a large number of errors with newer versions of PHP.

Phpcs is used by people who are contributing code, and they are more likely to be using newer versions of PHP. I think we can also support different versions of PHP on our development tooling and on the main Backdrop code without causing any problems for people.

I think @quicksketch said at the last dev meeting that PHP_CodeSniffer requiring PHP 5.4 only matters for running it, i.e., the 2.x branch will still sniff older versions of PHP, but it won't run in them. https://github.com/squizlabs/PHP_CodeSniffer/wiki/Configuration-Options#setting-the-php-version
@jenlampton I created a PR for https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/coder_review/issues/12 with the updated sniff rules.
Fantastic, I'll give it a test :) thank you!
@Joseph Flatt it looks like the PR you filed is for the wrong project?
hm, the patch seems to still apply locally. I'm having a really hard time getting github actions to apply the patch.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/purple/pull/8/checks?check_run_id=981763110

Update docblocs to coding standards. by jenlampton · Pull Request #8 · backdrop-contrib/purple
testing new phpcs check

git checkout doesn't work in GitHub actions
I did eventually get the patch to apply -- errors are on the PR :)
How about getting the zip file from here: https://github.com/hosef/coder/archive/issue-12-update-php-codesniffer.zip

@jenlampton I got the Github Actions to run phpcs on https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/ds/actions however it required that I use the one that composer installs when you run 'composer global require backdrop/coder'

backdrop-contrib/ds

@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) I have a branch at https://github.com/hosef/coder/tree/update-php-codesniffer with our sniff files updated to work with squizlabs/php_codesniffer:^3.0. Could you create a 3.x branch on https://github.com/serundeputy/coder for us to merge that into?

It runs fine for me using github actions and the contrib project @Joseph Flatt
I don't think we should use Geoff's personal project, we should be collaborating on contrib
Geoff's personal project is what our composer library points at though.
@Joseph Flatt I don't think that matters. We don't need composer, and if decide that we want to use compiser we can add something else that uses the correct name.
It's way more important that everyone who wants to work on coder_review is doing it in the same place
@Joseph Flatt I've added you as a maintainer to serundeputy/codrer
